conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the semi-cylindrical transparent object based on given conditions.
The radius of the semi-cylinder is R; light enters at point C, distance sqrt(3)/3 R from O; no light emitted from the right side, indicating TIR.
Consider geometry in the plane containing the incident ray and normal at point B on the curved surface to determine the incident angle.
Place semi-cylinder in a coordinate system with O at the origin; C has coordinates (0, sqrt(3)/3 R); B has coordinates (x, y) such that x^2 + y^2 = R^2.
Calculate slope of line OC as vertical; slope of line OB as y/x; angle i between lines is |x/y|.
Using x^2 + y^2 = R^2 and y = sqrt(3)/3 R, find x = sqrt(2/3) R and tan i = sqrt(2).
Apply Snell's Law and TIR: sin(theta_c) = 1/n; sin i = sin(arctan(sqrt(2))) = sqrt(2)/sqrt(3).
Solve for n: 1/n = sqrt(2)/sqrt(3) implies n = sqrt(3/2) = sqrt(1.5) = sqrt(6)/2.
